Hector.action: Encourages Lucinnius to visit Cyprian and try to reason with him, supporting Lucinnius's resolve.

Hector.action: Does as he is told without complaint, taking the torch and leaving the room discreetly.

Hector.action: Takes the torch from Thalia and discreetly leaves the room, hearing Lucinnius as he closes the door.

Hector.action: Quietly moves out of the room late at night, careful not to disturb the sleeping slaves around him.

Hector.action: Sits down beside Thalia on the roof and engages in a candid conversation about Lucinnius's situation.

Hector.action: Puts an arm around Thalia after their conversation.

Hector.action: Puts an arm around Thalia, offering physical comfort and intimacy.

Hector.action: Engages in matter-of-fact conversation while being physically intimate with Thalia, sharing moments of comfort and realness.

Hector.action: Expresses a desire for freedom and inclusion of Thalia in that hope.

Hector.action: Reassures Thalia that he will never leave her, emphasizing their bond.

Hector.action: Falls silent and yawns while still kissing Thalia, indicating tiredness.

Hector.action: Puts an arm around Thalia to comfort her while they talk.

Hector.action: Engages in a matter-of-fact conversation about their situation and possible freedom.

Hector.action: Admits he does not know which way his family is and cautions against unrealistic thinking.

Hector.action: Expresses commitment to Thalia, saying 'Never. It's you and me now. That's all.'

Hector.action: Yawns while speaking and shows signs of tiredness during an intimate moment.

Hector.action: Smiles at the Man and Woman sitting together in the henhouse and politely apologizes for disturbing them while fetching a chicken.

Hector.action: Carries a sleepy chicken gently in his arms while heading to make a sacrifice.

Hector.action: Follows Lucinnius's request to get a chicken for sacrifice without protest, despite being tired.

Hector.action: Follows Lucinnius out of bed wearily to get a chicken for a sacrifice.

Hector.action: Selects a chicken in the dark henhouse for sacrifice without hesitation.

Hector.action: Interacts politely and confidently with other slaves in the henhouse, acknowledging their presence and offering the roof as an alternative meeting place.

Hector.action: Keeps an eye on Lucinnius, like a mother watching her child from a distance on its first day at school.

Hector.action: Plays a game of five-stone with other slaves while watching Lucinnius, waiting patiently as Lucinnius is summoned.

Hector.action: Walks closely with Lucinnius to talk privately about his situation.

Hector.action: Keeps an eye on Lucinnius from a distance while playing a game of five-stone with other slaves.

Hector.action: Watches Lucinnius closely as he approaches the office and waits patiently for him to emerge.

Hector.action: Follows Lucinnius after the meeting, engaging him in conversation to assess the outcome.

Hector.action: Is visibly shocked upon hearing Lucinnius's despair and the threat against him.

Hector.action: Engages in conversation with Lucinnius about his dire situation, though expresses uncertainty about how to help.

Hector.action: Does not immediately reject Lucinnius's request to die together, but instead asks for clarification.

Hector.action: Does not offer concrete help or emotional encouragement to Lucinnius despite the latter's evident distress and request for solidarity.

Hector.action: Is shocked upon hearing about the severity of Lucinnius's situation and the threat of being dragged to Rome.

Hector.action: Expresses confusion and uncertainty about how to help Lucinnius and what is being asked of him.

Hector.action: Listens attentively to Lucinnius's plan and the gravity of the situation without interrupting or dismissing him.

Hector.action: Shows a close friendship with Gallus, Lucinnius's ten-year-old son, and finds comfort in the boy as a substitute for the family he lost.

Hector.action: Responds with shock and confusion when told he is implicated in a conspiracy, showing vulnerability and honesty.

Hector.action: After learning he is implicated as a conspirator, Hector asks calmly, 'Can I sit down?'

Hector.action: Finds comfort in a close friendship with Gallus, Lucinnius's son, during a time of extreme stress and impending death.

Hector.action: Engages patiently with Gallus in a thoughtful conversation about the shape of the world and his home.

Hector.action: Expresses tenderness toward Gallus when remembering their impending deaths.

Hector.action: Teases Gallus by questioning if he believes everything Greek tells him.

Hector.action: Asks Gallus to inquire about the gods and the wellbeing of his children.

Hector.action: Engages in a thoughtful discussion with Gallus about geography and the position of Rome, questioning assumptions and seeking answers.

Hector.action: Remembers the scheduled death of himself and the boy's father, yet shows tenderness and concern for Gallus and his children.

Hector.action: Asks Gallus to inquire about the gods' location in a round world, showing engagement with abstract and philosophical questions.

Hector.action: Interprets the chicken's behavior as indicating there is another way to avoid death, despite Lucinnius's insistence otherwise.

Hector.action: Remains silent and offers no help when Solus is questioned about the repeated chicken meals.

Hector.action: Shares a moment of hope with Lucinnius upon hearing that visitors from Cyprian have arrived.

Hector.action: Looks at Lucinnius and shares a moment of hope about the visitors.

Hector.action: Looks at Lucinnius and shares a moment of hope when two men from Cyprian arrive.

Hector.action: Hector listens attentively and obediently as the Visitor instructs him on how to kill, nodding along without showing discomfort.

Hector.action: Hector remains cold sober and grim-faced while Lucinnius is drunk and resigned.

Hector.action: Wakes up promptly when the crewman calls him to the deck and rouses Thalia as well.

Hector.action: Recognizes the ships heading for the port and correctly identifies that they are not lost despite initial doubt.

Hector.action: Moves to join Thalia after catching her eye and responds to her smile, sitting quietly and sharing a thoughtful moment.

Hector.assessment: Hector's question reveals curiosity and concern about Beatrice's past and losses, indicating empathy and sincere interest in her life.

Hector.action: Hesitates before following Beatrice into the house.
Hector.assessment: This hesitation suggests some uncertainty or lack of confidence in unfamiliar or potentially vulnerable situations, indicating a slight lack of decisiveness.

Hector.action: Looks silently at Beatrice when she asks if he wants to stay.
Hector.assessment: His silence here may indicate difficulty in expressing his intentions or emotions clearly, which could be seen as a lack of assertiveness or communicative competence.

Hector.action: Asks directly about the cause of Arnaud's death after seeing his clothing.
Hector.assessment: This question shows a practical and straightforward approach to understanding his new environment, reflecting curiosity and a degree of situational awareness.

Hector.action: Keeps his feelings to himself while Beatrice expresses affection and invites him to share a bed.
Hector.assessment: Hector's restraint and hesitation suggest a respectful and gentle nature, showing sensitivity to Beatrice's feelings without rushing or overwhelming her.

Hector.action: Shares a quiet, intimate moment with Beatrice, standing together on the ladder and looking at the bed she prepared.
Hector.assessment: This shared moment indicates Hector's willingness to connect and appreciate Beatrice's efforts, reflecting a sincere and friendly disposition.

Hector.action: Keeps his feelings to himself despite beginning to understand Beatrice's intentions and emotions.
Hector.assessment: This suggests a certain emotional restraint or difficulty in expressing himself, which may indicate a lack of social or emotional competence in this intimate situation.

Hector.action: Climbs the ladder and joins Beatrice in the attic space to see the bed she prepared.
Hector.assessment: This shows physical capability and willingness to engage with Beatrice's invitation, indicating some confidence and decisiveness.

Hector.action: His expression lightens and he considers taking up Beatrice's offer immediately, though he does not act on it before being interrupted.
Hector.assessment: This internal reaction shows some social awareness and openness, but his hesitation and inability to respond verbally suggest limited assertiveness or confidence in this context.

Hector.action: Stands quietly and seems unsure how to behave when introduced to Beatrice's children and mother.
Hector.assessment: Hector's confusion and hesitation suggest social awkwardness or discomfort rather than coldness; this is a neutral indicator of warmth.

Hector.action: Politely asks if there is water to drink and wash, using mime to communicate.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's respectful and non-demanding approach, indicating a gentle and sincere nature.

Hector.action: Accepts the company of the Boy who leads him to the well and seems to share a quiet moment drinking water together.
Hector.assessment: Hector's willingness to engage quietly with the child and appreciate the environment suggests openness and a gentle friendliness.

Hector.action: Stands, surrounded by instant family, and doesn't know what to do. Eventually he speaks, asking if there is water to drink and to wash, miming with his hands.
Hector.assessment: This shows some social uncertainty and lack of confidence in a new environment, but also a basic practical awareness and ability to communicate needs non-verbally, indicating moderate competence in adapting to unfamiliar social situations.

Hector.action: Follows Beatrice's instruction to go to the well with the Boy.
Hector.assessment: Hector complies promptly with directions, showing willingness to cooperate and follow guidance, which is a positive indicator of competence in social and practical contexts.

Hector.action: Stands shyly at the door watching the Mother work on lace, smiling gently.
Hector.assessment: Hector's gentle smile and shy presence indicate a respectful and affectionate attitude toward the Mother, showing warmth through his quiet attentiveness.

Hector.action: Insists the Mother take the good chair by the window despite her protests, offering to sit on the box himself.
Hector.assessment: This action demonstrates Hector's thoughtfulness and consideration for the Mother's comfort and needs, reflecting a sincere and caring nature.

Hector.action: Gently pacifies the Mother when she is unhappy about giving up the chair.
Hector.assessment: His gentle pacification shows patience and kindness, reinforcing his warm and tolerant disposition.

Hector.action: Retreats to the yard, aware of Beatrice watching him but does not engage or respond.
Hector.assessment: Hector's non-engagement here is neutral; it neither suggests warmth nor coldness, but a reserved or contemplative stance.

Hector.action: He gently pacifies the Mother and guides her back to the good chair, insisting she take the seat with the best light despite her initial resistance.
Hector.assessment: This action shows Hector's social tact, patience, and ability to manage delicate interpersonal situations with kindness and respect, indicating emotional intelligence and competence in social interactions.

Hector.action: He stands shyly at the door watching the Mother work on lace, smiling but not asserting himself to take the seat immediately.
Hector.assessment: This hesitation and shyness suggest a lack of assertiveness or confidence in this social context, which may indicate a moderate shortfall in social competence.

Hector.action: He splashes water on his face and contemplates decisions to be made.
Hector.assessment: This shows a moment of self-regulation and reflection, implying some level of thoughtful decision-making and self-awareness, which are positive indicators of competence.

Hector.action: Joins the Boy in working on the flower heads despite initial clumsiness.
Hector.assessment: Hector's willingness to join in and participate, even awkwardly, shows openness and friendliness toward the Boy and his family.

Hector.action: Sniffs the jar of liquid and shows interest in the Boy's work.
Hector.assessment: This indicates curiosity and engagement, signaling respect and sincere interest in others' activities.

Hector.action: Allows the old Mother to serve herself first and takes only a modest portion.
Hector.assessment: This is a polite and considerate gesture, showing respect for elders and a non-assertive, tolerant attitude.

Hector.action: Maintains eye contact and exchanges glances with Beatrice during the meal.
Hector.assessment: This suggests a friendly and possibly affectionate connection, indicating warmth and sincerity.

Hector.action: Does not react negatively or complain about the unpleasant odor from the cauldron or the bucket of liquid.
Hector.assessment: Hector's tolerance and restraint in the face of discomfort reflect patience and good-naturedness.

Hector.action: Joins the Boy in working with the flower heads despite initial clumsiness.
Hector.assessment: Hector shows willingness to engage and learn a new task, indicating adaptability and openness, though his initial clumsiness suggests limited skill at first.

Hector.action: Sniffs the jar of liquid and comments positively on the color of the cauldron's contents.
Hector.assessment: Hector demonstrates observational skills and attempts to understand the process, showing curiosity and some knowledge, which reflects moderate competence.

Hector.action: Leans over the cauldron to sniff the contents without thinking and reacts negatively to the odor.
Hector.assessment: This impulsive action shows a lack of caution and awareness of potential risks, indicating a momentary lapse in judgment and lower competence.

Hector.action: Interprets the Girl's gesture and word 'peepee' to understand the source of the bad smell.
Hector.assessment: Hector shows good interpretive skills and social awareness by making sense of unfamiliar communication, reflecting competent social intelligence.

Hector.action: Allows the old Mother to serve herself first and takes only a modest portion of food.
Hector.assessment: Hector demonstrates social tact and respect for local customs or power dynamics, indicating emotional intelligence and social competence.

Hector.action: Opens his heart to Beatrice, sharing his feelings honestly despite awkwardness.
Hector.assessment: Hector's willingness to be emotionally open and vulnerable with Beatrice shows sincerity and trustworthiness, indicating warmth.

Hector.action: Expresses liking Beatrice and compliments her by saying she smells wonderful.
Hector.assessment: Offering a genuine compliment and expressing liking in a tender moment reflects friendliness and good-natured behavior.

Hector.action: Fumbles awkwardly while saying goodbye and then leaves quietly.
Hector.assessment: The awkwardness and reluctance to part suggest Hector cares about Beatrice and the situation, showing emotional sensitivity and warmth.

Hector.action: He is making an effort to appear relaxed, but as he paces here and there, showing his unhappiness.
Hector.assessment: Hector's attempt to mask his true feelings suggests some self-awareness and emotional control, but his pacing indicates difficulty managing his internal state effectively.

Hector.action: Opens his heart to Beatrice, expressing his feelings honestly despite awkwardness.
Hector.assessment: This shows emotional intelligence and courage to be vulnerable, which are aspects of interpersonal competence, though it also reveals some social awkwardness.

Hector.action: Fumbles awkwardly with his bag before walking off down the track.
Hector.assessment: This moment of clumsiness undermines the impression of confidence and skill, indicating a lack of physical or social grace in this situation.

Hector.action: Decides to leave despite personal feelings, acknowledging it would be wrong to stay just a while.
Hector.assessment: This decision reflects good judgment and self-discipline, showing Hector's ability to act responsibly and thoughtfully.

Hector.action: Sits down by the river at dusk when the boatman has gone for the night, unable to continue his journey immediately.
Hector.assessment: This shows practical awareness of his situation and patience, but also a lack of immediate resourcefulness to find an alternative solution.

Hector.action: Shares a peaceful dream about lying under a tree and drinking clear water with Andre.
Hector.assessment: Hector's sharing of a gentle, pleasant dream with Andre suggests a moment of openness and a desire to connect, indicating some warmth and friendliness.

Hector.action: Looks around at the distressed people on the raft and says, 'God, this is the worst, the worst.'
Hector.assessment: Hector's expression of despair shows empathy and awareness of others' suffering, which is a positive indicator of warmth.

Hector.action: Maintains a conversation with Andre, his slave, who is described as quiet and capable.
Hector.assessment: Hector's engagement in conversation with Andre, rather than ignoring or dismissing him, suggests a degree of respect and sincerity, though the master-slave dynamic tempers this somewhat.

Hector.action: Hector awakens fully and immediately assesses his surroundings, noting the raft made of many smaller rafts lashed together and the large number of people on it.
Hector.assessment: This shows situational awareness and an ability to quickly grasp the reality of a complex and dangerous situation, indicating competent observational skills.

Hector.action: Hector speaks calmly to Andre, his slave and companion, sharing a dream and acknowledging their dire situation.
Hector.assessment: His calmness and communication suggest emotional control and leadership potential, which are aspects of competence in crisis.

Hector.action: Hector looks around at the distressed people and expresses despair, saying 'God, this is the worst, the worst.'
Hector.assessment: This expression of despair may indicate a momentary emotional overwhelm or lack of immediate problem-solving response, which slightly detracts from his competence.

Hector.action: Hector remains seated and does not intervene in the argument or chaos erupting among the people on the raft.
Hector.assessment: His non-action in the face of conflict and disorder could suggest passivity or inability to assert control, which negatively impacts the perception of his competence.

Hector.action: Responds to Andre's question about seeing Europe with a teasing remark: 'I think there's more chance of me eating you, Andre.'
Hector.assessment: Hector's teasing response suggests a playful and familiar rapport with Andre, indicating friendliness and a light-hearted approach to a grim situation.

Hector.action: Observes a man (Francisco) protecting a sleeping woman (Ursula) with a cloak and shares a long, meaningful gaze with Francisco.
Hector.assessment: Hector's attentive observation of others' care and suffering shows empathy and sensitivity to the emotions of those around him, reflecting a warm and considerate nature.

Hector.action: Responds to Andre's question about seeing Europe with a confident, somewhat dark humor: 'I think there's more chance of me eating you, Andre.'
Hector.assessment: This response shows Hector's quick wit and confidence, suggesting mental sharpness and a certain level of self-assurance in a dire situation.

Hector.action: Observes the people around him carefully, noting their costumes, weapons, mannerisms, and inferring their time period and situation.
Hector.assessment: This indicates strong observational skills and intelligence, as Hector is able to analyze his environment and make educated guesses about their circumstances.

Hector.action: Holds a prolonged gaze with Francisco, noting the antipathy and pain in their look.
Hector.assessment: This shows emotional awareness and perceptiveness, suggesting Hector is attuned to social cues and underlying tensions, which is a sign of social competence.

Hector.action: Does not take any direct action or leadership role despite the tense situation on the raft.
Hector.assessment: Hector's passivity here may indicate a lack of initiative or confidence in taking charge, which could be seen as a negative indicator of competence in crisis management.

Hector.action: Nudges Nuno out of the way to help Ursula with her baggage, then wrestles the load from her and angrily dumps it on the sand.
Hector.assessment: Hector's intention to help Ursula shows concern and willingness to assist, which is a positive indicator of warmth. However, his forceful and angry manner, as well as overriding Ursula's refusal, suggests a lack of sensitivity and respect for her autonomy, which detracts from his warmth.

Hector.action: Works his oar with the rest, helping to row the raft through heavy ocean surf.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's physical capability and willingness to contribute effectively in a difficult and dangerous situation, indicating a competent and reliable nature.

Hector.action: Overtakes Nuno and forcibly takes Ursula's load from her shoulders despite her refusal.
Hector.assessment: This action demonstrates physical strength and decisiveness, but also a lack of sensitivity or tact, which may undermine social competence; it shows confidence but also potential impulsiveness or insensitivity.

Hector.action: Keeps his attention focused on Ursula during the chaotic beaching and struggle for possessions.
Hector.assessment: This indicates situational awareness and emotional focus, suggesting a competent ability to prioritize important relationships even under stress.

Hector.action: Offers Francisco a carpet and some cloth to work together on a better shelter.
Hector.assessment: Hector's offer to collaborate and improve living conditions shows a sincere and friendly attempt to mend past wounds and be cooperative.

Hector.action: Accepts Francisco's harsh rejection without argument or retaliation.
Hector.assessment: Hector's restraint and lack of confrontation in the face of rejection suggests tolerance and a non-hostile attitude, reflecting patience and goodwill.

Hector.action: Carries his possessions with Andre, walking two paces behind, reminiscent of his past as a slave.
Hector.assessment: This behavior suggests a lack of assertiveness and confidence, as Hector does not take charge of his own belongings and allows another to carry them, reflecting a diminished sense of agency.

Hector.action: Approaches Francisco to propose working together on a shelter using his carpet and cloth.
Hector.assessment: This action shows initiative, problem-solving skills, and a willingness to collaborate, indicating a competent and constructive approach to improving his situation.

Hector.action: Does not respond forcefully or escalate when Francisco rejects his offer and insults him.
Hector.assessment: Hector's passive response to rejection may indicate a lack of confidence or assertiveness, which can be seen as a negative indicator of competence in social interactions.

Hector.action: Walks briskly with Francisco toward the trouble caused by the deserters and pursuers.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's alertness and readiness to engage with unfolding events, indicating situational awareness and decisiveness.

Hector.action: Observes the situation at Dom Paulo's office as the deserters are brought in and listens to the exchange between Francisco and Dom Paulo.
Hector.assessment: Hector's presence at the center of the conflict suggests he is involved in important matters and attentive to leadership dynamics, reflecting a competent engagement with social and political challenges.

Hector.action: Hesitates and drops his hand when asked to vote for the death of the Deserters, after making eye contact with one of them.
Hector.assessment: Hector's hesitation and refusal to immediately join the majority in voting for execution shows his internal conflict and a degree of empathy and reluctance to harm others, indicating warmth.

Hector.action: Hesitates and struggles internally while voting on the fate of the Deserters, repeatedly raising and lowering his hand under social pressure.
Hector.assessment: This action shows Hector's internal conflict and lack of decisiveness in a critical moment, indicating uncertainty and a lack of confidence in his judgment.

Hector.action: Scans the crowd and makes eye contact with the Deserter, showing empathy and moral consideration despite the pressure to conform.
Hector.assessment: While this demonstrates emotional intelligence and moral awareness, it also contributes to his indecision, which may undermine his ability to act decisively and confidently in leadership situations.

Hector.action: Hector hesitates to volunteer to conduct the executions and ultimately does not accept the role, allowing another to step forward.
Hector.assessment: Hector's hesitation and refusal to take on the grim task suggests a reluctance to cause harm, indicating a degree of empathy or moral sensitivity, which can be seen as a positive indicator of warmth.

Hector.action: Dom Paulo looks at Hector to volunteer for conducting the executions, but Hector neither accepts nor refuses the responsibility.
Hector.assessment: Hector's hesitation and inability to respond to a direct call for action suggests a lack of decisiveness and courage, indicating lower competence in leadership or crisis situations.

Hector.action: Hector is relieved when another young man, Alvarez, volunteers to conduct the executions.
Hector.assessment: Hector's relief at avoiding responsibility shows avoidance behavior and a lack of confidence or willingness to take charge, which negatively reflects on his competence.

Hector.action: Tells Andre to go and sleep by the big fire to keep warm.
Hector.assessment: Hector shows consideration and care for Andre's comfort and well-being by encouraging him to stay warm.

Hector.action: Thanks Nuno for the fruits he brings despite Hector's own hunger.
Hector.assessment: Hector expresses gratitude sincerely, showing respect and appreciation even when he is in need himself.

Hector.action: Quickly stows away his food and responds with irritation when Nuno calls him.
Hector.assessment: Hector's irritation and secretive behavior about his food suggest a guardedness and lack of openness, which may indicate lower warmth in this moment.

Hector.action: Observes Andre building his tent and compliments him with 'Good work, Andre.'
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's ability to recognize and encourage others' efforts, indicating social awareness and leadership qualities.

Hector.action: Instructs Andre to sleep by the big fire to keep warm.
Hector.assessment: This demonstrates practical thinking and concern for others' well-being, reflecting responsible and capable behavior.

Hector.action: Quickly hides his food when Nuno approaches and responds with a grunt of irritation.
Hector.assessment: Hector's quick reaction to hide his food suggests cautiousness and awareness of scarcity, but the irritation may indicate stress or poor emotional control.

Hector.action: Accepts the fruits from Nuno and carefully decides to try only two despite the risk.
Hector.assessment: This shows prudent decision-making and self-preservation instincts, reflecting a competent approach to uncertain situations.

Hector.action: Responds to Nuno's request for help regarding the boy Lopo.
Hector.assessment: Hector's willingness to engage with a difficult and potentially dangerous situation indicates moral courage and a readiness to act, which are aspects of competence.

Hector.action: Offers to share food with Nuno, suggesting 'perhaps, one of yours and one of mine...'
Hector.assessment: This shows a considerate and sharing nature, indicating kindness and a willingness to support others even in difficult circumstances.

Hector.action: Encourages Nuno to keep strong for the sake of others, saying 'we'll need strong people like you...'
Hector.assessment: Hector tries to motivate and comfort Nuno, showing concern for his emotional state and the wellbeing of the group, reflecting a supportive and caring attitude.

Hector.action: Tells Nuno to try not to think about Lopo, acknowledging the harsh reality that the guards wouldn't let him near.
Hector.assessment: While this is a realistic and somewhat harsh statement, it is delivered with the intent to protect Nuno from further emotional pain, showing a protective and empathetic side.

Hector.action: Shouts cheerily 'Goodnight!' to Nuno as he stomps away in silence.
Hector.assessment: Hector attempts to maintain a friendly and positive demeanor despite the grim situation, indicating a sincere effort to be kind and uplifting.

Hector.action: Advises Nuno to conserve strength and not waste food, emphasizing the need to be strong for the difficult times ahead.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's practical thinking and foresight, indicating a level of competence in managing scarce resources and morale under harsh conditions.

Hector.action: Attempts to comfort Nuno by telling him not to dwell on Lopo's fate and encouraging him to focus on survival.
Hector.assessment: Hector demonstrates emotional intelligence and leadership qualities by trying to maintain morale, which is a competent response in a crisis.

Hector.action: Shouts cheerfully 'Goodnight!' to Nuno after the boy stomps away silently.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's effort to maintain a positive atmosphere despite grim circumstances, reflecting emotional resilience and social competence.

Hector.action: Says 'I hate it when people have to die.' while watching the hangings.
Hector.assessment: Expressing sorrow over death shows Hector's empathy and sensitivity to human suffering, indicating warmth.

Hector.action: Says 'It's foolish squabbling at all. We should be friends....' in response to Francisco's comment about killing their own men.
Hector.assessment: Hector advocates for friendship and peace rather than conflict, demonstrating a good-natured and tolerant attitude.

Hector.action: Sidles up to Francisco, hoping to ingratiate himself.
Hector.assessment: Hector's attempt to connect with Francisco suggests a desire for friendly relations, though the word 'ingratiate' may imply some self-interest or insecurity.

Hector.action: Sidles up to Francisco, attempting to ingratiate himself while observing tense events.
Hector.assessment: Hector shows social awareness and attempts to build rapport in a difficult situation, indicating some social skill and confidence.

Hector.action: Expresses dislike of death and advocates for friendship during a tense moment.
Hector.assessment: While well-intentioned, Hector's statement may be naive or overly idealistic given the harsh realities around him, suggesting limited strategic insight.

Hector.action: Gives Francisco a small bundle of bread and raisins for him and 'her'.
Hector.assessment: Hector's gesture of giving food privately, outside the communal sharing, shows thoughtfulness and a desire to care for others personally, indicating warmth and sincerity.

Hector.action: Says 'It's foolish squabbling at all. We should be friends.'
Hector.assessment: This statement reflects Hector's wish for harmony and friendship, showing tolerance and a good-natured attitude.

Hector.action: Calls out 'I must speak to her!' after Francisco walks away.
Hector.assessment: Hector's insistence on speaking to 'her' suggests a concern or emotional investment, indicating a sincere desire to connect or resolve issues.

Hector.action: Takes a small bundle of bread and raisins from his jacket and gives it to Francisco, explaining it is for 'her... and you.'
Hector.assessment: This action shows Hector's thoughtfulness and ability to act independently and kindly, indicating emotional intelligence and social competence.

Hector.action: Shrugs when Francisco looks for an angle, showing no hidden motives and simply seeking to retrieve lost friendship.
Hector.assessment: Hector's straightforwardness and honesty here suggest self-awareness and confidence in his intentions, reflecting a competent social demeanor.

Hector.action: Calls out that he must speak to 'her' after Francisco walks away.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's assertiveness and willingness to take initiative in communication, a sign of confidence and social competence.

Hector.action: Shares the limited supply of turtle eggs with others at the camp.
Hector.assessment: Hector participates in the communal meal, indicating a willingness to share resources and be part of the group.

Hector.action: Expresses annoyance quietly when eggs are spoiled but does not complain to others or cause conflict.
Hector.assessment: Hector manages his frustration internally without disrupting the group's positive mood, showing tolerance and restraint.

Hector.action: Asks Andre about the quality of his eggs in a straightforward manner.
Hector.assessment: Hector’s inquiry is simple and direct, showing some interest in others’ experiences, though it lacks warmth or deeper engagement.

Hector.action: Removes six large eggs from a bag and attempts to cook them for food.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's practical approach to making use of available resources, indicating basic survival skills and initiative.

Hector.action: Inspects the eggs by cracking them open and shaking them to assess their quality.
Hector.assessment: This demonstrates careful observation and a methodical approach to problem-solving, reflecting a competent and thoughtful mindset.

Hector.action: Expresses annoyance at the poor quality of the eggs but does not immediately discard them or seek alternatives.
Hector.assessment: While he notices the problem, his failure to quickly find a better solution or communicate urgency suggests some limitation in adaptability or resourcefulness.

Hector.action: Looks to Andre for confirmation about the quality of his eggs.
Hector.assessment: This indicates a willingness to seek input and verify information, which is a sign of practical intelligence and social competence.

Hector.action: Hector promises Andre he will call him by his real name when he remembers it, despite initially forgetting it.
Hector.assessment: Hector shows a willingness to respect Andre's wish and identity, indicating sincerity and a desire to be considerate, though his forgetfulness slightly undermines this.

Hector.action: Hector calls out to a youth making noise on the harmonium, asking him to stop for the sake of older and sick people, and offers an egg as an incentive.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's concern for others' comfort and his friendly, good-natured approach by offering a reward rather than just demanding silence.

Hector.action: Hector smiles at his own insensitivity after telling Andre they are not going to die.
Hector.assessment: This moment reveals a lack of sensitivity and awareness of Andre's feelings, indicating a lapse in warmth and empathy.

Hector.action: Hector tries to crack eggs to find something usable but ends up with a dried-up, half-formed baby turtle.
Hector.assessment: This action shows Hector's persistence in trying to find food or resources despite poor results, indicating some resourcefulness but also a lack of success in this instance.

Hector.action: Hector engages in a conversation with Andre about names and identity, showing some emotional awareness but also admits to forgetting Andre's real name and makes a somewhat insensitive joke.
Hector.assessment: Hector demonstrates social interaction skills and attempts to comfort Andre, but his forgetfulness and insensitivity suggest some lapses in emotional intelligence and memory.

Hector.action: Hector promises to call Andre by his real name when he remembers it, showing an attempt to honor Andre's wishes.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector's willingness to accommodate others and keep promises, reflecting a degree of social competence and reliability.

Hector.action: Hector tries to stop a youth from playing the harmonium loudly by offering an egg as a bribe.
Hector.assessment: This action shows Hector's practical problem-solving skills and ability to negotiate, indicating social tact and some leadership qualities.

Hector.action: Hector gives up on the eggs and instead pulls out bread and fruit from the tent for food.
Hector.assessment: This shows adaptability and practical decision-making in the face of failure, reflecting competent resource management.

Hector.action: Hector drifts off down to the beach while others are engaged in selecting and organizing barter goods.
Hector.assessment: Hector's choice to disengage from the group activity and drift off suggests a lack of initiative or focus on the task at hand, indicating a possible lapse in responsibility or attentiveness.

Hector.action: He quickly searches through discarded boxes and crates to find nails and wood, showing resourcefulness and survival skills.
Hector.assessment: While this action shows Hector's practical survival skills, it does not directly indicate warmth as it is more about self-preservation.

Hector.action: Hector watches a young boy and girl making love and then confronts the boy, telling him to stop and get back to camp to help others.
Hector.assessment: Hector's intervention shows a protective and responsible attitude toward the young couple and concern for the needs of others, indicating a degree of sincerity and care.

Hector.action: Quickly searches through discarded boxes and crates on the beach, finds a piece of wood with nails, pulls out the nails and pockets them.
Hector.assessment: This action shows resourcefulness, practical survival skills, and an ability to identify and collect useful materials in a challenging environment.

Hector.action: Climbs over a dune cautiously, ducks and retreats, then crawls up to observe a young couple from a concealed position.
Hector.assessment: This demonstrates careful observation, patience, and tactical awareness, indicating a thoughtful and strategic approach to situations.

Hector.action: After being spotted by the boy and girl, Hector decides to brazen it out by standing up in full view and confronting them directly.
Hector.assessment: This shows confidence and assertiveness, though it may also suggest a risk-taking or somewhat impulsive approach that could backfire depending on context.

Hector.action: Stops the Boy and others from bothering the Girl, telling them to leave her alone and return to camp.
Hector.assessment: Hector intervenes to protect the Girl from teasing or harm, showing a protective and caring attitude.

Hector.action: Realizes he has hurt the Boy and Girl by his words and tries to call the Boy back, apologizing and explaining it was a joke.
Hector.assessment: Hector shows self-awareness and remorse for causing emotional pain, indicating sincerity and concern for others' feelings.

Hector.action: Apologizes to the Girl, but she does not respond, and Hector curses quietly, feeling angry with himself.
Hector.assessment: Hector's apology and frustration with himself demonstrate genuine regret and a desire to make amends, reflecting warmth despite the social awkwardness.

Hector.action: Runs off towards the camp after seeing the procession of the Native King and his people.
Hector.assessment: This action is neutral with respect to warmth; it shows initiative but no clear indication of warmth or coldness.

Hector.action: Stops the Boy and tells him to leave the Girl alone and return to camp, attempting to assert authority.
Hector.assessment: This shows Hector trying to take charge and manage the situation, indicating some confidence and willingness to intervene.

Hector.action: Realizes he has hurt the Boy and Girl emotionally and feels remorseful, calling after the Boy to apologize and clarify his intentions.
Hector.assessment: This demonstrates emotional awareness and a capacity for self-reflection, which are aspects of social competence, though his initial action was clumsy.

Hector.action: Calls out apologies to the Girl, who ignores him, and then curses quietly in frustration.
Hector.assessment: His apology shows accountability, but his frustration and failure to repair the damage suggest limited skill in managing interpersonal conflict effectively.

Hector.action: Observes the arrival of the Native King and his people and promptly runs off towards the camp to presumably prepare or respond.
Hector.assessment: This indicates situational awareness and readiness to act in response to important developments, reflecting practical competence and alertness.

Hector.action: Sits down beside Nuno and offers him one of his bones to eat.
Hector.assessment: Hector shows kindness and generosity by sharing his scarce food with Nuno, despite having little himself.

Hector.action: Apologizes to Nuno for chasing him away earlier.
Hector.assessment: Hector demonstrates sincerity and a willingness to make amends, indicating good-natured and trustworthy behavior.

Hector.action: Risks the searing heat to pull at a couple of blackened bones from the fire.
Hector.assessment: This action shows Hector's willingness to endure discomfort to secure food, indicating practical survival skills and a proactive attitude.

Hector.action: Sits beside Nuno and offers him one of his bones, encouraging him to suck out the marrow.
Hector.assessment: This demonstrates social awareness, empathy, and leadership by sharing resources and guiding others, reflecting emotional intelligence and interpersonal competence.

Hector.action: Apologizes to Nuno for chasing him away earlier.
Hector.assessment: This shows self-awareness and accountability, traits that contribute to effective social interactions and group cohesion, indirectly supporting competence.

Hector.action: Apologizes to Nuno for being mean and explains he was upset but not really angry at him.
Hector.assessment: Hector shows self-awareness and a desire to repair the relationship, indicating sincerity and good-naturedness.

Hector.action: Seeks reassurance from Nuno about whether he still likes him and expresses that mutual liking and respect are important.
Hector.assessment: This demonstrates Hector's concern for maintaining positive, respectful relationships and his friendly, trusting nature.
